instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
hi,
<CHIP>U5000</CHIP> was covered in smc flux and it looked really bad. So, I replaced smc. Now, with dc cable on, it has 0.30A & nothing happens. With its battery on, no change, it doesn't turn on, fan turns, greenlight , battery not charging

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Did you get SMC from donor board, same model?
Can you post some voltages and signals from power on sequence?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
same model bought new from aliexpress
Can you tell me which signals should I check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
NEW, isn't from donor board???

Disconnect battery, use only original Magsafe 2 charger.
Do you get voltage at L7310/20?
If yes, check <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
no new smc ,
L7310/20 =no voltage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Which coils get voltage now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
L7630 = 1 Voltage
L7439 = 1.2 Voltage
L7560 = 3.3 Voltage
L7520 = 5 Voltage
L7130= 8.20 Voltage
L3095 = No Voltage
L7701 = No Voltage

8.2V at F7140?

F7140 = 8,20 voltage

threads.message:
So missing <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.
Remove <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and test it again.

There is a problem with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Why do you need to post all these, even repost, if I asked about one signal???
I saw the value in previous post, just wanted to make you avoid wasting time in the future...

Start removing each power good resistor from <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, one by one; <RESISTOR>R8164</RESISTOR>/65/66/68.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R8167</RESISTOR> is good; does it have 3V at pin 1?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
before i checked what you wrote i noticed <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> is too hot
I checked the <CAPACITOR>C8080</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8081</CAPACITOR> in diode mode, it gives = 0.008 
I removed the <CAPACITOR>C8080</CAPACITOR>  and <CAPACITOR>C8081</CAPACITOR> and then checked it again no problem but <CAPACITOR>C8080</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8081</CAPACITOR> pin 1 diode mode, it gives = 0.008 
should i replace the <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
before i checked what you wrote i noticed <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> is too hot
I checked the <CAPACITOR>C8080</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8081</CAPACITOR> in diode mode, it gives = 0.008
I removed the <CAPACITOR>C8080</CAPACITOR>  and <CAPACITOR>C8081</CAPACITOR> and then checked it again no problem but <CAPACITOR>C8080</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8081</CAPACITOR> pin 1 diode mode, it gives = 0.008
so i changed <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> and  <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> gives  3,3 voltage :) ( <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> I put it back) but same not turn on  it has 0.30A & nothing happens

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Do you get 3V at both <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> = 3.4 voltage  (<RESISTOR>R1963</RESISTOR> pin2)
 <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>  =3.4 voltage (<RESISTOR>R1962</RESISTOR> pin2)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Looks like PCH issue.
Heat it with quality flux, in case of accumulated crap issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Is the <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> not faulty?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: i heated it on bga still the same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Clean/remove J6100.
Also check all resistors from LPC bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: meanwhile the battery is not charging Could it be related to smc? I said before that I changed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
If you replaced with SMC from donor (good) board, it should charge the battery.
If not, there is other problem.
